thread.title: Witches set out to cast a spell on Donald Trump, and they'll do it again
thread.title_full: Witches set out to cast a spell on Donald Trump, and they'll do it again - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Witches set out to cast a spell on Donald Trump, and they'll do it again
text:
Photo: Facebook Image 1 of / 48 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 48 Witches cast a spell on Donald Trump A group of witches turned to Facebook to help recruit people to cast a spell on President Donald Trump and his followers. >>>Click through to see more about the witches and their spell less Witches cast a spell on Donald Trump A group of witches turned to Facebook to help recruit people to cast a spell on President Donald Trump and his followers. >>>Click through to see more about the witches and ... more Photo: Facebook Image 2 of 48 Group effort A group of witches turned to social media to gather help in casting a spell on President Donald Trump. But the spell wasn't intended to harm him. Rather, they want to keep him from harming others. Group effort A group of witches turned to social media to gather help in casting a spell on President Donald Trump. But the spell wasn't intended to harm him. Rather, they want to keep him from harming others. Photo: Facebook Image 3 of 48 Instructions available The witches looking to put a binding spell on Donald Trump and his followers even gave Facebook users instructions on how to cast the spell and answer questions about their intent. Instructions available The witches looking to put a binding spell on Donald Trump and his followers even gave Facebook users instructions on how to cast the spell and answer questions about their intent. Photo: Facebook Image 4 of 48 FAQ The witches casting a spell on President Donald Trump sought to reassure those who took part. They posted answers to frequently asked questions, telling Christians that some people were simply praying for Trump to mend his ways. less FAQ The witches casting a spell on President Donald Trump sought to reassure those who took part. They posted answers to frequently asked questions, telling Christians that some people were simply praying for ... more Photo: Facebook Image 5 of 48 Spell casting, live The witches posted their spell casting live on Facebook, which drew a variety of comments, both for and against. Spell casting, live The witches posted their spell casting live on Facebook, which drew a variety of comments, both for and against. Photo: Facebook Image 6 of 48 Some opposition Not everyone was enamored with or amused by the witches plan to cast a spell. A number of self-proclaimed Christians took to Facebook to denounce the idea. Some opposition Not everyone was enamored with or amused by the witches plan to cast a spell. A number of self-proclaimed Christians took to Facebook to denounce the idea. Image 7 of 48 PHOTOS: Protest signs from Donald Trump's Inauguration Day from around the world
Protesters are pictured holding placards during a demonstration against U.S. President Donald J. Trump outside the United States Embassy in London on January 20, 2017 in London, England. Mr Trump has become the 45th President of the United States following an inauguration ceremony in Washington, DC today.

A woman protests against the new US President Donald Trump, in Mexico City during his inauguration day on January 20, 2017.
Photo: RONALDO SCHEMIDT/AFP/Getty Images Image 9 of 48 Protesters standing in front of the Brandenburg Gate take part in a gathering to voice their opposition to new U.S. President Donald Trump on the day of his inauguration on January 20, 2017 in Berlin, Germany. Trump is for the most part unpopular in Germany and in a recent interview threatened German automakers with import tariffs, setting the stage for a possible trade conflict.

Donald Trump was sworn in as the 45th president of the United States Friday -- capping his improbable journey to the White House and beginning a four-year term that promises to shake up Washington and the world.

less A woman holds a sign calling on Democrats to Organise, Agitate and Educate during a protest march by members of the Democratic Party Abroad organisation to mark the inauguration of President Donald Trump, on
... more Photo: Barcroft Media/Barcroft Media Via Getty Images Image 48 of 48 Witches set out to cast a spell on Donald Trump, and they'll do it again 1 / 48 Back to Gallery If this story sounds crazy, well, it fits into the mood of the country lately.
A group of self-proclaimed witches took to Facebook - yes, apparently witches use social media - in an attempt to have a large, group spell cast on President Donald Trump and his supporters.
The goal of the spell, they said, was not to harm the 45th president, but rather to bind him - stop Trump from doing any harm to others.
READ IT: Best signs from Donald Trump protest rallies
The spell went off at midnight , just as Friday, Feb. 24 became Saturday, Feb. 25.
While the social media postings drew some support and encouragement, a surprising number of Trump supporters took shots at the witches for their efforts.
Photo: Facebook Source: Facebook Source: Facebook A Facebook user named Verdayne Quote: : "In the mighty name of Jesus, I rebuke you and your cause. No curse or spell will be formed against President Trump, or those who abet him."
The witches, though, seem undeterred.
TRAVEL BAN: Texas colleges stand to lose big if Trump's immigration policy is imposed
For good measure, they plan on repeating the effort ritually - "To be performed at midnight on every waning crescent moon until he is removed from office."
Did the spell work? It just depends on how someone sees Trump's actions and whether his policies and politics are seen as harmful.
If you’re looking an idea that’s a little more outside the box to resist Republican Donald Trump; a group of witches has planned on casting a “mass spell” on the President. Jose Sepulveda (@josesepulveda87) has more.
Media: MediaOS Video >>>Scroll through the above gallery to see more about the witches and their spell, then keep clicking to see some of the best signs from recent Donald Trump protests in Houston
